The 3 margin is because the mouse is followed by simulating key press.
So, it won't stop right toward the mouse beause of inertia.

Aim exactly at the mouse.
It also allows to aim without hovering, on a touch device for instance.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectStack
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An ordered list of objects and a shuffle action.
description: It provides:
* Actions to modify a stack of objects
* Conditions to access the objects of a stack
* A shuffle action
It can be helpful for:
* Card games
* Fair randomness (for instance, to create a stack of predetermined bonus and randomize the order they appear)
2 examples use it:
* A card system demonstration ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://card-system))
* A Klondike solitaire ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://klondike-solitaire))

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CurvedMovement
description: This extension allows to move objects on Bzier curve paths.
- Paths can be built dynamically or from predetermined paths in SVG format.
- A behavior moves objects in a given duration a bit like the Tween extension does.
- Another behavior moves objects using a speed and an acceleration.
- Expressions give access to the path trajectory values for more complex movements.
This extension can be used to:
- Move enemies that follow a pattern
- Animate decorations
A collection of [small examples](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://curved-movement) show how to use this extension.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to check the cursor movement (still or moving).
description: Provides two conditions:
* The cursor is moving
* The cursor has stayed still for a given duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor has stayed still for the specified time on the default layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CursorStayStill
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cursor has stayed still for _PARAM1_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is moving on the default layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CursorIsMoving
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cursor is moving

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
It handles:
- Cooldown between shots
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
- Ammo management
- Overheat
It can be used for:
- Twin-stick shooters ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://conviction-of-gun-dude-desktop))
- Shoot'em up ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-shooter))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Increase heat (if needed)
Check if this caused overheat
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward an object.

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing cooldown
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects cannot shoot while firing cooldown is active
propertyDescriptors.name: FireCooldown

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing arc
propertyDescriptors.description: Multi-Fire bullets will be evenly spaced inside the firing arc
propertyDescriptors.name: FiringArc

propertyDescriptors.label: Number of bullets created at once (Multi-Fire)
propertyDescriptors.description: Multi-Fire bullets will be evenly spaced inside the firing arc
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletQuantity

propertyDescriptors.label: Rotate bullets to match their trajectory
propertyDescriptors.name: RotateBullet

propertyDescriptors.label: Reloading duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects cannot shoot while reloading is in progress
propertyDescriptors.name: ReloadDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Total shots fired
propertyDescriptors.description: Regardless of how many bullets are created, only 1 shot will be counted per frame
propertyDescriptors.name: TotalShotsFired

propertyDescriptors.label: Heat increase per shot (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object is overheated when Heat reaches 1
propertyDescriptors.name: HeatIncreasePerShot

propertyDescriptors.label: Overheat duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Object cannot shoot while overheat duration is active
propertyDescriptors.name: OverheatDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Exponential cooling rate (per second)
propertyDescriptors.description: Happens faster when heat is high and slower when heat is low
propertyDescriptors.name: ExponentialCoolingRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer the bullets are created on
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletLayer

propertyDescriptors.label: Bullet speed variance
propertyDescriptors.description: Bullet speed will be adjusted by a random value within this range
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletSpeedVariance

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Turret
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A turret movement with customizable speed, acceleration and stop angles.
description: With this behavior, you can make an object rotate like a turret toward a position.
It may be used with the **Bullet** extension to fire objects.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: A turret movement with customizable speed, acceleration and stop angles.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Turret

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the turret is moving.
eventsFunctions.name: IsMoving
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ is moving

eventsFunctions.description: Move clockwise.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveClockwise
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM0_ clockwise

eventsFunctions.description: Move counter-clockwise.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCounterClockwise
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM0_ counter-clockwise

events.comment: Origin angle is the farest angle from AngleMin and AngleMax, it's used by MoveToward

eventsFunctions.description: Set angle toward a position.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set aiming angle toward a position
eventsFunctions.name: SetAimingAngleToward
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the aiming angle of _PARAM0_ toward _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_

events.comment: Use OriginAngle to obtain an angle that is the nearest from AngleMin and AngleMax

eventsFunctions.description: Move toward a position.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveToward
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM0_ toward _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ within a _PARAM4_ margin

events.comment: Use OriginAngle to obtain an angle that is the nearest from AngleMin and AngleMax
There is stop angles
No stop angle, the direction is chosen according to the shortest path (never more that 180)

eventsFunctions.description: Change the aiming angle.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAimingAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the aiming angle of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

events.comment: Use mod to avoid the angle value to be too large.
There are stop angles, the angle is bounded by these.

eventsFunctions.description: Aiming angle (between 0 and 360 if no stop angle are set).
eventsFunctions.name: AimingAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum rotation speed (in degrees per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: SpeedMax

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum angle (use the same value for min and max to set no constraint)
propertyDescriptors.name: AngleMax

propertyDescriptors.label: Minimum angle (use the same value for min and max to set no constraint)
propertyDescriptors.name: AngleMin

propertyDescriptors.label: Origin angle: the farest angle from AngleMin and AngleMax
propertyDescriptors.name: OriginAngle
